qas.question: When did Hu Yaobang visit Tibet?
When did monks in the Drepung and Sera monasteries start protesting for independence?
What did the government do when it halted reforms?
When was the most recent Tibetan unrest?
For what have the Beijing and Lhasa goverments been criticized?

plausible_answers.text: monks in the Drepung and Sera monasteries

qas.question: Who started protesting for independence in 1980?
What organisations have been critical of Tibet and Beijing's governments?
What protests are the 1980 independence protests compared to?

context: In <a0_0>1980<a0_0/>, General Secretary and reformist <b5_0>Hu Yaobang<b5_0/> visited Tibet and ushered in a period of social, political, and economic liberalization. At the end of the decade, however, analogously to the <b8_0>Tiananmen Square protests<b8_0/> of <a1_0>1989<a1_0/>, <b6_0>monks in the Drepung and Sera monasteries<b6_0/> started protesting for independence, and so the government halted reforms and <a2_0>started an anti-separatist campaign<a2_0/>. <b7_0>Human rights organisations<b7_0/> have been critical of the Beijing and Lhasa governments' approach to <a4_0>human rights<a4_0/> in the region when cracking down on separatist convulsions that have occurred around monasteries and cities, most recently in the <a3_0>2008<a3_0/> Tibetan unrest.
